title: Audit standard/ workflow agents for holistic coherence
description: Review all agents in standard/.claude/agents/ (orchestrator.md, spec-agent.md, plan-agent.md, implement-agent.md, verify-agent.md) to ensure: (1) file path references are correct and consistent, (2) terminology aligns across all agents, (3) handoff protocols between agents are clear, (4) alignment with Spec->Plan->Execute->Verify workflow documented in CLAUDE.md.
completion_notes: Comprehensive audit completed. All five agents (orchestrator, spec-agent, plan-agent, implement-agent, verify-agent) are coherent and well-aligned. Findings: (1) File paths consistent - all use .claude/context/ and .claude/tasks/ correctly; (2) Terminology aligned - 'Spec → Plan → Execute → Verify' used consistently, status values match; (3) Handoff protocols clear - agent-handoff.md documents Orchestrator↔Specialist format, each agent has Inputs/Outputs sections; (4) Workflow alignment verified - CLAUDE.md, workflow-guide.md, and all agents agree on phase definitions and transitions. No issues found requiring fixes. The system is coherent as a whole.
notes: Audit was read-only; no changes needed. The agent system is production-ready.

assumptions.description: Five agents cover the complete workflow
Agents use consistent terminology for workflow phases
assumptions.validation_method: Extract and compare terminology across files

decision_rationale: Audit approach: Read all 5 agent files, 2 reference files (agent-handoff.md, workflow-guide.md), and CLAUDE.md. Cross-referenced terminology, file paths, and handoff criteria. No changes needed because the system was well-designed from the start.
